name: National Talent Search Examination (NTSE)
eligibility: Meritorious students of Class 10 (state + national stages)

name: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship (NMMS)
eligibility: Students from economically weaker families (state-wise selection)

name: Central Sector Scheme of Scholarship (via NSP)
eligibility: Meritorious students with income criteria — apply on National Scholarship Portal

name: INSPIRE (DST) - MANAK / SHE
eligibility: Science/innovation talent; separate streams for school awards and higher-education scholarships

name: CBSE Merit Scholarship for Single Girl Child
eligibility: Single girl child who passed CBSE Class X and pursues Class XI/XII from CBSE school

name: Azim Premji Foundation Scholarship
level: After Class 10 / 12 (focus on girls from government schools)
eligibility: Girls from government schools seeking undergraduate courses; see foundation page for details

name: Aakash Scholarships (coaching & merit programmes)
level: Students preparing after Class 10 / 12 for boards & entrance exams
eligibility: Merit-based (exam on Aakash portal) — coaching fee waivers & scholarships

name: Maulana Azad National Scholarship Scheme (for meritorious minority girls)
eligibility: Meritorious girl students from minority communities — check MAEF site

name: Aditya Birla Scholarships
eligibility: High-performing students selected for UG/PG professional courses (see site for institute list)

name: Tata Trusts / Tata Scholarships (grants & individual scholarships)
eligibility: Different Tata programmes cover school and higher-ed students — check Tata Trusts Education grants
